1:
In my distress I called out to Yahweh,\q and he answered me.
\q
2:
Rescue my life, Yahweh, from those who lie with their lips\q and deceive with their tongues.


\q
3:
How will he punish you, and what more will he do to you,\q you who have a lying tongue?
\q
4:
He will punish you with the arrows of a warrior\q sharpened over burning coals of the broom tree.


\q
5:
Woe is me because I temporarily live in Meshech;\q I lived previously among the tents of Kedar.
\q
6:
For too long I have lived\q with those who hate peace.
\q
7: I am for peace,\q but when I speak, they are for war.
